concept.title: JSONiq Debugger Perspective
concept.shortdesc: The JSONiq Debugger perspective allows you to detect problems in a JSONiq transformation by executing the process step by step in a controlled environment.

conbody.p: The JSONiq Debugger perspective allows you to detect problems in a JSONiq transformation by executing the process step by step in a controlled environment. To switch the focus to this perspective, select the JSONiq Debugger button in the top-right corner of the interface or Window > Open perspective > JSONiq Debugger.

The workspace in this perspective is organized as an editing area assisted by special helper views. The editing area contains editor panels that you can split horizontally or vertically in a stack of JSON editor panels and a stack of JSONiq editor panels. The JSON files and JSONiq files can be edited in Text mode only.

The layout of this perspective is composed of the following components:
Menus Provides menu driven access to all the features and functions available in the JSONiq Debugger.
Toolbars Contains all actions needed to configure and control the debugging process. The toolbars can be configured to suit your specific needs.
JSON Source Pane The editing pane where you can display and edit data or document-oriented JSON documents.
JSONiq Source Pane The editing pane where you can display and edit JSONiq files.
Output View Displays the transformed output that results from the input of a selected document (JSON) and selected JSONiq document to the JSONiq transformer. The result of transformation is dynamically written as the transformation is processed. There are two types of views for the output: a text view (with JSON syntax highlight) and an XHTML view.
Debugging Information Views Presented in two panes, they display various types of information that can be used to understand the transformation process. For each information type there is a corresponding tab. While running a transformation, relevant events are displayed in the various information views. This allows you to obtain a clear view of the transformation progress. See the Debugging Information Views topic for a list of all the information views (and links to more details on each view).
